intro: Plumatichilos turfosus, commonly known as the mossy cushion plant, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white, woolly hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is considered an important component of alpine ecosystems.
